Package com.roscopeco.moxy.impl.asm

Class ASMMoxyEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.roscopeco.moxy.impl.asm.ASMMoxyEngine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MoxyEngine

    public class ASMMoxyEngine
extends Object
implements MoxyEngine
    Default MoxyEngine implementation. Based on bytecode generation with ASM.
    Author:
    Ross Bamford <roscopeco AT gmail DOT com>

      • getRecorder

        public ThreadLocalInvocationRecorder getRecorder​()

      • getMatcherEngine

        public MoxyMatcherEngine getMatcherEngine​()
        Description copied from interface: MoxyEngine

        Obtain the MoxyMatcherEngine that this MoxyEngine uses to service argument matchers.

        Matcher engines are closely tied to the MoxyEngine implementation and as such there is no way to replace the matcher engine.

        Specified by:
        getMatcherEngine in interface MoxyEngine
        Returns:
        The MoxyMatcherEngine in use by this MoxyEngine.

      • reset

        public void reset​()
        Description copied from interface: MoxyEngine

        Reset this engine.

        Implementations may choose to globally reset the mocking framework, or to reset only for the current thread. This must be documented with the engine implementation.

        The default engine reset()s on a per-thread basis.

        Specified by:
        reset in interface MoxyEngine

      • mock

        public <T> T mock​(Class<T> clz)
        Description copied from interface: MoxyEngine

        Create a mock instance of the given class.

        The mock will be created in the engine's default ClassLoader. For the default engine, this is the same ClassLoader that loaded the engine.

        Note: This method will not call a constructor on the generated instance. If you require a constructor be called, please see MoxyEngine.getMockClass(Class) and friends.

        Specified by:
        mock in interface MoxyEngine
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type being mocked.
        Parameters:
        clz - The Class to mock.
        Returns:
        A new mock instance.
        See Also:
        MoxyEngine.mock(Class, PrintStream)

      • mock

        public <T> T mock​(Class<T> clz,
                  PrintStream trace)
        Description copied from interface: MoxyEngine

        Create a mock instance of the given class.

        The mock will be created in the engine's default ClassLoader. For the default engine, this is the same ClassLoader that loaded the engine.

        Note: This method will not call a constructor on the generated instance. If you require a constructor be called, please see MoxyEngine.getMockClass(Class) and friends.

        During creation of the mock, this method will also dump the generated bytecode, in a debugging format, to the supplied PrintStream.

        Specified by:
        mock in interface MoxyEngine
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type being mocked.
        Parameters:
        clz - The Class to mock.
        trace - If non-null, the resulting class will be dumped (with a TraceClassVisitor) to the given stream.
        Returns:
        A new mock instance.
        See Also:
        MoxyEngine.mock(Class)

      • getMockClass

        public <I> Class<? extends I> getMockClass​(ClassLoader loader,
                                           Class<I> clz,
                                           Set<Method> methods,
                                           PrintStream trace)
        Description copied from interface: MoxyEngine

        Create a mock class of the given class and then define it in the given ClassLoader.

        This method allows only a specific subset of methods to be mocked. Please note, however, that any abstract methods will always be mocked in order to generate loadable classes. This also applies to interfaces, in which all methods (except those with a default implementation) are considered abstract.

        The MoxyEngine class provides two useful constants you may want to use for the methods parameter:

        
   MoxyEngine.ALL_METHODS       // mock all methods
   MoxyEngine.NO_METHODS        // mock no methods

        Generated Mock classes will define public pass-through constructors to all public constructors on the superclass (if concrete), or a single public constructor (if mocking an interface). These constructors will have the same arguments as the original constructor, with a single argument of type MoxyEngine prepended.

        Therefore, to instantiate a mock from a class, you will need to obtain the appropriate constructor via reflection and call it, passing in the MoxyEngine that created the mock followed by any other arguments the constructor requires.

        These constructors are generated primarily for use with partial mocking. If you are mocking the entire class (i.e. all methods) you may prefer to use MoxyEngine.mock(Class) and friends instead.

        During creation of the mock, this method will also dump the generated bytecode, in a debugging format, to the supplied PrintStream.

        Specified by:
        getMockClass in interface MoxyEngine
        Type Parameters:
        I - The type being mocked.
        Parameters:
        loader - The ClassLoader to define the new class in.
        clz - The original class.
        methods - Set of Methods to mock.
        trace - If non-null, the resulting class will be dumped (with a TraceClassVisitor) to the given stream.
        Returns:
        The new Class object.

      • getMockClass

        public <I> Class<? extends I> getMockClass​(ClassLoader loader,
                                           Class<I> clz,
                                           Set<Method> methods)
        Description copied from interface: MoxyEngine

        Create a mock class of the given class and then define it in the given ClassLoader.

        This method allows only a specific subset of methods to be mocked. Please note, however, that any abstract methods will always be mocked in order to generate loadable classes. This also applies to interfaces, in which all methods (except those with a default implementation) are considered abstract.

        The MoxyEngine class provides two useful constants you may want to use for the methods parameter:

   MoxyEngine.NO_METHODS        // mock no methods

        Generated Mock classes will define public pass-through constructors to all public constructors on the superclass (if concrete), or a single public constructor (if mocking an interface). These constructors will have the same arguments as the original constructor, with a single argument of type MoxyEngine prepended.

        Therefore, to instantiate a mock from a class, you will need to obtain the appropriate constructor via reflection and call it, passing in the MoxyEngine that created the mock followed by any other arguments the constructor requires.

        These constructors are generated primarily for use with partial mocking. If you are mocking the entire class (i.e. all methods) you may prefer to use MoxyEngine.mock(Class) and friends instead.

        Specified by:
        getMockClass in interface MoxyEngine
        Type Parameters:

        Parameters:

      • getMockClass

        public <I> Class<? extends I> getMockClass​(Class<I> clz,
                                           Set<Method> methods)
        Description copied from interface: MoxyEngine

        Create a mock class of the given class and then define it in the engine's default ClassLoader.

        For the default engine, the default ClassLoader is the same ClassLoader that loaded the Moxy framework.

        This method allows only a specific subset of methods to be mocked. Please note, however, that any abstract methods will always be mocked in order to generate loadable classes. This also applies to interfaces, in which all methods (except those with a default implementation) are considered abstract.

        The MoxyEngine class provides two useful constants you may want to use for the methods parameter:

        
   MoxyEngine.ALL_METHODS       // mock all methods
   MoxyEngine.NO_METHODS        // mock no methods

        Generated Mock classes will define public pass-through constructors to all public constructors on the superclass (if concrete), or a single public constructor (if mocking an interface). These constructors will have the same arguments as the original constructor, with a single argument of type MoxyEngine prepended.

        Therefore, to instantiate a mock from a class, you will need to obtain the appropriate constructor via reflection and call it, passing in the MoxyEngine that created the mock followed by any other arguments the constructor requires.

        These constructors are generated primarily for use with partial mocking. If you are mocking the entire class (i.e. all methods) you may prefer to use MoxyEngine.mock(Class) and friends instead.

        Specified by:
        getMockClass in interface MoxyEngine
        Type Parameters:
        I - The type being mocked.
        Parameters:
        clz - The original class.
        methods - Set of Methods to mock.
        Returns:
        The new Class object.
        See Also:
        MoxyEngine.getMockClass(ClassLoader, Class, Set)

      • getMockClass

        public <I> Class<? extends I> getMockClass​(Class<I> clz,
                                           Set<Method> methods,
                                           PrintStream trace)
        Description copied from interface: MoxyEngine

        Create a mock class of the given class and then define it in the engine's default ClassLoader.

        For the default engine, the default ClassLoader is the same ClassLoader that loaded the Moxy framework.

        This method allows only a specific subset of methods to be mocked. Please note, however, that any abstract methods will always be mocked in order to generate loadable classes. This also applies to interfaces, in which all methods (except those with a default implementation) are considered abstract.

        The MoxyEngine class provides two useful constants you may want to use for the methods parameter:

        
   MoxyEngine.ALL_METHODS       // mock all methods
   MoxyEngine.NO_METHODS        // mock no methods

        Generated Mock classes will define public pass-through constructors to all public constructors on the superclass (if concrete), or a single public constructor (if mocking an interface). These constructors will have the same arguments as the original constructor, with a single argument of type MoxyEngine prepended.

        Therefore, to instantiate a mock from a class, you will need to obtain the appropriate constructor via reflection and call it, passing in the MoxyEngine that created the mock followed by any other arguments the constructor requires.

        These constructors are generated primarily for use with partial mocking. If you are mocking the entire class (i.e. all methods) you may prefer to use MoxyEngine.mock(Class) and friends instead.

        During creation of the mock, this method will also dump the generated bytecode, in a debugging format, to the supplied PrintStream.

        Specified by:
        getMockClass in interface MoxyEngine
        Type Parameters:
        I - The type being mocked.
        Parameters:
        clz - The original class.
        methods - Set of Methods to mock.
        trace - If non-null, the resulting class will be dumped (with a TraceClassVisitor) to the given stream.
        Returns:
        The new Class object.
        See Also:
        MoxyEngine.getMockClass(ClassLoader, Class, Set, PrintStream)

      • getMockClass

        public <I> Class<? extends I> getMockClass​(Class<I> clz,
                                           PrintStream trace)
        Description copied from interface: MoxyEngine

        Create a mock class of the given class and then define it in the engine's default ClassLoader.

        For the default engine, the default ClassLoader is the same ClassLoader that loaded the Moxy framework.

        Generated Mock classes will define public pass-through constructors to all public constructors on the superclass (if concrete), or a single public constructor (if mocking an interface). These constructors will have the same arguments as the original constructor, with a single argument of type MoxyEngine prepended.

        Therefore, to instantiate a mock from a class, you will need to obtain the appropriate constructor via reflection and call it, passing in the MoxyEngine that created the mock followed by any other arguments the constructor requires.

        These constructors are generated primarily for use with partial mocking. If you are mocking the entire class (i.e. all methods) you may prefer to use MoxyEngine.mock(Class) and friends instead.

        During creation of the mock, this method will also dump the generated bytecode, in a debugging format, to the supplied PrintStream.

      • isMock

        public boolean isMock​(Class<?> clz)
        Description copied from interface: MoxyEngine

        Determines whether the supplied class is a mock class.

        How this determination is made is implementation-dependent, but may rely on the fact that the class has the (mandatory) Mock annotation.

        Specified by:
        isMock in interface MoxyEngine
        Parameters:
        clz - The class to query.
        Returns:
        true if the class is a mock, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        MoxyEngine.isMock(Object)

        Description copied from interface: MoxyEngine

      • resetMock

        public void resetMock​(Object mock)
        Description copied from interface: MoxyEngine

        Reset the supplied mock, removing all stubbing that was previously applied.

        Note that this does not operate on a thread-local basis, (since stubbing is not thread-local) and that it does not reset previous invocation data for the mock. If you wish to reset that, see MoxyEngine.reset().

        Specified by:
        resetMock in interface MoxyEngine
        Parameters:
        mock - The mock to reset
        See Also:
        MoxyEngine.reset()

      • when

        public <T> MoxyStubber<T> when​(InvocationSupplier<T> invocation)
        Description copied from interface: MoxyEngine

        Starts stubbing of the mock invocation in the supplied lambda expression.

        The invocation of the mock is used to determine which method and argument combination is to be stubbed and is not counted toward mock invocation, return or throw counters.

        Example usage:

        
 engine.when(() -> mock.someMethod("one", "two")).thenReturn("three");

        The arguments passed to the mock within the lambda may be either immediate arguments, other mocks, or argument matchers (see Matchers).

        See MoxyStubber for details on the stubbing methods available.

        Specified by:
        when in interface MoxyEngine
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type being stubbed (the return type of the mocked method).
        Parameters:
        invocation - A lambda that will invoke the method to be stubbed.
        Returns:
        A MoxyStubber that will stub the given method.
        See Also:
        MoxyEngine.when(InvocationRunnable), MoxyStubber

      • when

        public MoxyVoidStubber when​(InvocationRunnable invocation)
        Description copied from interface: MoxyEngine

        Starts stubbing of the mock invocation in the supplied lambda expression.

        The Java compiler will automatically select this overload of the when method when the method to be stubbed is void.

        The invocation of the mock is used to determine which method and argument combination is to be stubbed and is not counted toward mock invocation, return or throw counters.

        Example usage:

        
 engine.when(() -> mock.voidMethod("one", "two")).thenThrow("three");

        The arguments passed to the mock within the lambda may be either immediate arguments, other mocks, or argument matchers (see Matchers).

        See MoxyStubber for details on the stubbing methods available.

        Specified by:
        when in interface MoxyEngine
        Parameters:
        invocation - A lambda that will invoke the method to be stubbed.
        Returns:
        A MoxyVoidStubber that will stub the given method.
        See Also:
        MoxyEngine.when(InvocationSupplier), MoxyStubber

      • assertMock

        public MoxyVerifier assertMock​(InvocationRunnable invocation)
        Description copied from interface: MoxyEngine

        Starts verification of the mock invocation in the supplied lambda expression.

        The invocation of the mock is used to determine which method and argument combination is to be verified and is not counted toward mock invocation, return or throw counters.

        Example usage:

        
 engine.assertMock(() -> mock.voidMethod(engine, "one", "two")).wasCalled();

        The arguments passed to the mock within the lambda may be either immediate arguments, other mocks, or argument matchers (see Matchers).

        See MoxyStubber for details on the stubbing methods available.

        Specified by:
        assertMock in interface MoxyEngine
        Parameters:
        invocation - A lambda that will invoke the method to be stubbed.
        Returns:
        A MoxyVerifier that will verify the given method.
        See Also:
        MoxyVerifier
